info.game_comments:
First game of Season 23.
Updated "HD-friendly" set.
New title graphics.
Jeopardy! begins broadcasting in HDTV.

(1, 1).clue: It begins, "The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not want"

(2, 1).clue: Wall Street laid an egg in October of this Roaring '20s year when the stock market crashed

(3, 1).clue: Nicknamed "Papa Bear", he not only coached the Chicago Bears for 40 seasons, he played baseball for the Yankees

(4, 1).clue: In Illinois it's good to be the king, or at least this butterfly, the state insect

(5, 1).clue: You can be a Chunk Spelunker for this ice cream

(6, 1).clue: Traditionally, a dense one of these is compared to "pea soup"

(1, 2).clue: 23 different pilgrims tell their stories in this late-14th century classic

(2, 2).clue: Following his resignation in this year, we didn't have Richard Nixon to kick around anymore

(3, 2).clue: He was the first coach to win an NCAA football championship & a Super Bowl

(4, 2).clue: It might want to fly away home to Massachusetts, where it's the state insect

(5, 2).clue: The logo of this brand is seen here

(6, 2).clue: This 6-letter word for a tornado's shape is also a kitchen utensil

(1, 3).clue: Legend says in 490 B.C., Pheidippides ran about 23 miles from this plain to Athens to announce a victory

(2, 3).clue: The U.S. officially entered World War I in April of this year

(3, 3).clue: He & son Dave are the only father & son coaches to coach against each other as head coaches in the NFL

(4, 3).clue: It wasn't until 1983 that Utah finally made this its state insect

(5, 3).clue: It calls itself "pure cane sugar from Hawaii"

(6, 3).clue: In the loose sense, it's any weather vane, but specifically it's one with a rooster on it

(1, 4).clue: The classical form of this language used only 23 letters; J, U & W were added at a later date

(2, 4).clue: The first Summer Olympics broadcast in color were held in Mexico City in this year

(3, 4).clue: The son of this pro football Hall of Famer is a U.S. senator

(4, 4).clue: Alaska's state insect is the "four spot skimmer" this, so keep it away from St. George

(5, 4).clue: This Scottish Whisky traces its roots to Italian distiller Giacomo Justerini

(6, 4).clue: (Jeff Probst reports from Palau.)  Luckily, Palau is outside the zone of these storms, whose name comes from a Chinese word that means "great wind"

(1, 5).clue: This important parallel of latitude is located at 23 degrees, 27 minutes north of the equator

(2, 5).clue: In this year Chiang Kai-shek fled to Taiwan & Red China established the People's Republic

(3, 5).clue: He won 3 Super Bowls & now owns a NASCAR racing team

(4, 5).clue: It's tough to separate church & state in Connecticut while having this as state insect

(5, 5).clue: Ray-Ban glasses, developed by this company, were so named because they reduce UV & infrared rays

(6, 5).clue: The name of this job comes from the Greek for "discussion of celestial phenomena" (stay tuned)

(1, 1).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew goes for gold in St. Petersburg, Russia.)  Russian craftsmen have recreated the Amber Room here in the Catherine Palace, which had been plundered by these people in 1941

(2, 1).clue: 1990:Sean defects to the U.S. & brings his high-tech sub with him

(3, 1).clue: This "Christmas Carol" clerk's children are Peter, Martha, Belinda, Tiny Tim & 2 who don't have names

(4, 1).clue: The square root of the square root of 16

(5, 1).clue: Contrapuntal is the adjectival form of this, the combination of melodic lines

(1, 2).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew is our girl in Moscow, Russia.)  From 1953 to 1961, Lenin shared his tomb with this leader who was then moved to his present resting place in the Kremlin wall

(3, 2).clue: Drinking beer, kicking dogs & hitting women are hobbies of this man, Fagin's adult accomplice

(5, 2).clue: A Lalo "Symphonie" got this national name because it was composed for virtuoso Pablo de Sarasate

(6, 2).clue: Process that turns grape juice into wine(12)

(1, 3).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew rushes back to Palace Square in St. Petersburg.)  In 1905 a peaceful demonstration here on Palace Square turned into a massacre known in history as this bloody day of the week

(2, 3).clue: 1989:Sean helps his archaeologist son search for the Holy Grail
(2, 3).correct response: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

(3, 3).clue: Paul Dombey styles himself "sole representative" of this firm

(5, 3).clue: In 1866 he began teaching at the new Moscow Musical Conservatory now often called by his name

(6, 3).clue: Slang for a policeman who walks the beat(8)

(1, 4).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from "poetic" Russia.)  I'm here in the town originally called Detskoye Selo, which in 1937 was renamed for this great Russian poet

(2, 4).clue: 1996:Sean shows an elite team of SEALs how to break into Alcatraz to stop a madman

(3, 4).clue: Nathan Winkle is among the illustrious members of this title club

(5, 4).clue: Popular in 18th century opera, the Da Capo Aria had 2 sections & then the singer was supposed to do this

(1, 5).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew shares a photo op on Red Square.)  Legend says that Ivan the Terrible lived up to his nickname when he blinded the designers of this cathedral so they could never again build anything as beautiful

(2, 5).clue: 1976:After returning home from the Crusades, Sean battles the Sheriff of Nottingham

(3, 5).clue: He marries Dora Spenlow in Chapter 43 & Agnes Wickfield in Chapter 62

(5, 5).clue: The Academy of St. Martin in the Fields claims to be the world's most recorded of these small orchestras

(0, 0).clue: In tropical Africa it's the main source of calories in the diet; in the U.S. it gives us a pudding
